website_summaries.verdict: The Razer Nari Essential is a budget-friendly wireless gaming headset that will please PC gamers with its powerful audio performance.
cons: 7.1-channel surround and EQ tweaks are only available on PC

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 drowns moaning girlfriend out
customer_reviews.text: 10/10 use this headset to drown my moaning girlfriend out, could recommend to anyone who has an annoying girlfriend
customer_reviews.author: Tim baker

customer_reviews.title: BEST HEADSET I'VE EVER OWNED
customer_reviews.text: i've owned the Man o'war 7.1 kraken 7.1 usb, kraken and nari essential and the nari ultimate is by far the best headset i've ever owned, the haptic feature really changes the way i game and listen to music, its more intimate, the sound quality is gorgeous and NOW I HAVE THE TRUE POWER TO TAKE DOWN T-SERIES.....BIG PP
customer_reviews.author: Chris Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good if you know what you’re doing
customer_reviews.text: Flawless headset, absolutely love the haptic feedback. I love the way you can use it via Bluetooth or using the 3.5mm cable supplied. Most negative reviews about this headset are from people who don’t know what they’re doing when it comes to the headset or they don’t know enough about it and complain. This headset will work wirelessly using the 2.4ghz usb stick on PC and PS4 ONLY. If you want to use this headset with a mobile device or an Xbox console you must use the 3.5mm aux cable which comes in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Josh T

customer_reviews.title: Unique experience but not for everyone
customer_reviews.text: The impulse (aka vibration) feature is a unique experience but it does get annoying and distracting after a while. The headset is on the heavier side and I found the ear cups to get uncomfortably warm after a while. There is also plastic/chemical smell which I believe is from the cooling gel. Mic quality is not the best for its price but adequate for online gaming. Synapse 3 software was great with enough customization. Finally the battery is disappointing and it will need changing almost every day.
customer_reviews.author: CriticOS

customer_reviews.title: Very Underwhelming
customer_reviews.text: I brought these to replace my Man o war headset as they were didnt have much clamping force, and these are only slightly better. The earcups and headband are quite comfortable. The sound quality is sub par for a £200 headset and amid all the reports of broken microphones i would probably recommend not buying these. Going to return for the Arctis 7 Wireless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: By far the best Razer headset!
customer_reviews.text: Feels 10x more comfortable then my older headset Turtle Beach Elite! RGB looks really nice and sound is very good! I would rate this a high competitor to the best out there at the moment!
customer_reviews.author: Jonny Hadden

customer_reviews.title: Not Actually Gel Cooling According to Razer
customer_reviews.text: Not real cooling Gel cushions. Just leather (fake leather) that feels cool initially (as it does), but then heats up very quickly. My ears have been heating up alot since I brought these (in under 30 mins), just days ago. Much warmer than my previous Logitech G933, and its not even been that hot in the UK recently. I contacted Razer support, wondering if its possible I have the wrong cushions as they also sell non gel-cushion ones. They said they aren't actually supposed to cool you down and its not real Gel Cuishons (not the type in gel pillows).
customer_reviews.author: AAB

customer_reviews.title: The build quality of this headset is pathetic.
customer_reviews.text: The build quality of this headset is shockingly bad. The green pieces of plastic at the end of the headband are flimsy and held together with tiny screws that snap because they are under pressure and the swivels that hold the earpieces on are made from injection moulded plastic that snaps under the slightest pressure needed to put the headset on. All this after receiving a set already broken in the box. the razer kraken headset although wired is a much better purchase as the framework is made of metal and is less than half the price of this £200 ripoff headset.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Complete rubbish
customer_reviews.text: These things are massive. I have a big head and they felt loose on me. The sound quality is very poor and the mic is beyond a joke for headset that costs this much money. As for the amount of options in sound settings none really make a difference. I am a loyal Razer customer and wanted a wireless headset to finish my Razor set up. Sadly these will be sent back.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Rudge

customer_reviews.title: BEEPS BEEPS and more BEEPS
customer_reviews.text: well i have had this headset for about 4 months now first week was going alright then out of the blue it starts beeping at me i have tryed everything updating the headset updating razer synapses. also when it beeps at me my razer naga mouse all the keybinds i have on it mess up and you have to reset synapse for them to load again i never had a problem with synapse untill i got this headset!! This headset is not worth the money i have had nothing but problems and it also does not help that razer don't help you !
customer_reviews.author: Ash smith

customer_reviews.title: Comfy but avoid
customer_reviews.text: The headset is very comfy to wear, and the ear cups are soft and "breathable". However, the auto adjust head band makes this headset loose and it will fall from your head. The sound quality is terrible, which even worth than my speaker. It gives you a muddy and unrefined sound when you listen to music. For gaming, the bass is too strong and you can only hear the gun fire, the bomb. Footstep are definite be heard but it doesn't have a strong direction feeling. For gaming and music, it is hard to recommend this headset. But if you are looking for the comfy and the nice rgb lights, go for it and mute all the negative reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: uncomfortable to wear for long periods
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are quite heavy and are uncomfortable when used for long periods. Also you have to be careful when taking them on and off as the volume control and the on/off button seems to be where you place your hands to remove them. The recharge lead stopped working after a couple of times but to be fair they did replace it. But you do get the benefit of no leads so thats a + . Personally i would not buys these for gamers who are going to use them for long periods of time due them being uncomfortable, something a little less heavy .
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Kjp Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Great value, hard to find item unless premium price paid
customer_reviews.text: Check it out elsewhere on YouTube, speaks for itself. Recommended x
customer_reviews.author: RogerH

customer_reviews.title: I truly despair 😂
customer_reviews.text: This month I have tried five headsets. None work how they should. The Nari is no exception. Constant feedback down mic even with mic monitoring at minimum on Xbox. Every time 3.5mm cable touches your shirt you hear it. Can’t mute mic using button on headset if using wired on Xbox one... Naively I believed the dongle would allow me to use headset wirelessly with Xbox.... 😂 Seriously... 😂 A real shame as the audio quality and comfort are outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. S. Turnbull

customer_reviews.title: Razor Nari replacement for Razor Kraken 7.1
customer_reviews.text: My Razor Kraken V2 7.1 headphones broke after 5 years good service this week, I ordered these going for something wireless that should be on par. Boy was I wrong, the sound in comparison was like I had bought a Ford Fiesta not the Audi A8 I had paid for. Very disappointed with Razor, while wireless is nice we buy headphones for the sound and these were a step back in sound quality but a step up in price. I will now look at other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Gary B

customer_reviews.title: Great PC headset from Razer.
customer_reviews.text: A really comfy headset and sound quality is fantastic. This is definitely a better headset for pc gaming as you have more control over the settings than on the PS4 as you can’t use the game/chat volume so you have to keep going into the PS4 setting to re-adjust the volume and you can’t turn the rumble setting off so it rumbles in every game which can become distracting and in game chat my friends said they could hear the rumble in there headset so became a problem only on the PS4 all these settings are adjustable on the pc. My opinion is great PC headset just not practical for the PS4.
customer_reviews.author: Jason A.

customer_reviews.title: RGB makes annoying sound but overall decent headset
customer_reviews.text: When you have the lights turned on, the headphones make a weird constant beeping sound. Wasn't a fan of the THX audio (razer audio) so I keep it on stereo, and it's pretty good. The microphone is not the best, but at least it has lots of customizable features. The software is amazing, easy to use and simple. The wireless feature is amazing and I can't imagine going back to wired.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Amazing audio, awful microphone
customer_reviews.text: Razer Nari Ultimate - This headset is amazing! The sound quality is perfect, the configuration is perfect and the haptics are so cool! This is hands down the best headset I’ve ever owned, it’s super comfy and unlike my Razer Krakens they don’t hurt my ears after a while. The only problem with the headset is the microphone is awful. I purchased this headset and as soon as I turned my microphone on everyone was complaining how bad it sounds. I tried changing all my settings but nothing helped. What I’m trying to say is the audio quality and comfort of this headset is amazing but if you don’t have a microphone separate then I wouldn’t bother getting this headset.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Greaves

customer_reviews.title: razer nari essential doesn't come with chroma as product title described
customer_reviews.text: these headphones are great, sound's great, noise cancellation's great all that good stuff. but i bought these thinking that they had rgb chroma as stated in the product title, only to find out that they actually don't. i bought these because they're a cheaper option to some of the other razer headsets, but i'm kinda disappointed that the product title is misleading. other than that they're great but PLEASE change the product title for the nari essentials
customer_reviews.author: Ruby Allen

customer_reviews.title: Superb sound
customer_reviews.text: I brought these for my switch lite to play overwatch superb headset downfall is that the lead to plug into the switch the microphone does not work yet with the retriever plug into the laptop it does I don’t no but I have brought a usb for my switch so will see if that that works with the transmitter but other then that perfect headset the sound is amazing and the lighting is pretty cool to
customer_reviews.author: charlene

customer_reviews.title: Terrible... DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product I’m disgusted having to pay over £100 for a product that doesn’t work properly with its own system ‘Razer synapse’. Go for Logitech or another company this one just lets you down. All I can hear when I play is buzzing apparently one of the ways to fix this is is to delete all the drivers but once you’ve done that you cannot open Razer synapse to configure your headset. Absolute waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared for a new experience
customer_reviews.text: The haptic feedback on these things is amazing, don't set it too high or you will shake your head off. The effect is like having really loud base speakers next to your ears but without the volume, it has opened up a whole new level of immersion for me. You will need the software counterpart (Synapse 3) which is still in BETA. It is a little tricky to set up but it is worth the effort. Overall the gain is worth the pain...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Microphone is trash
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality was good, and it was comfy to wear over long periods of time, however the microphone quality was like nothing I have ever seen before, it sounded muffled and distant, and when I went looking for a fix I only found more people suffering with the same issue and "fixes" that straight up didn't work. Additionally, it is only supported on the newest razer synapse that never seemed to work properly. STAY AWAY.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Price

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, sounds decent but there are much better options
customer_reviews.text: Its a very comfortable headset. However there are far better options than this. Sounds good but thx spatial isnt winning any points for me. Sounds of footsteps can be heard well but a bit tiny. Dont touch anything in the EQ settings on synapse
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Wahjudi

customer_reviews.title: Ultimate headphones on a pc
customer_reviews.text: Awesome headphones for music whilst working on the pc. Shame you can't connect to a phone over Bluetooth, and was really hoping they would work with Bluetooth on stadia controllers. You can use the 3.5 jack for audio if you want which still works really well. For gaming and chat such as on discord, I'm still yet to find the perfect balance for game/chat but I'm sure I'll get it eventually. Glad I purchased overall and the retractable mic is great for when you don't need it in your face.
customer_reviews.author: PTester

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound quality
customer_reviews.text: The quality of these headphones is amazing, during gameplay I can literally hear surround sound due to the 7.1 channel. The fact that they are wireless is even better as there is no wires in my way when playing and the microphone is retractable so if I don't need it I just keep it inside the headphone and pull it out when I need it. It even has a neat mute button that when I click it the tip of the microphone goes red so you know that it is muted.
customer_reviews.author: K.P.

customer_reviews.title: Microphone does not work at all
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are amazing for sound, immersion, comfort and amazing build quality but... I have had two of these because the microphone does not work after the first use. It does not have the best microphone in the first place but they don't even work. It works with a 3.5mm jack and a splitter but not wirelessly. If you are looking for a better wireless razer headset get the razer thresher ultimate as it comes with extras like a headphone stand is easy to use on pc (I dont know about console) and have better sound quality and a better microphone
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Lincoln-Williams

customer_reviews.title: An amazing versitile product for a fair price
customer_reviews.text: These are the best wireless headphones I have ever used. After using turtle beach Stealth 600 to these is a drastic increase in performance. Once I upgraded to pc I purchased these for my main headphones and I was not disappointed. The synapse 3 program, despite being in beta, is refined and has worked flawlessly with my cynosa and deathadder for amazing and unique combinations in both lighting and audio adjustment. The bass boosted mode is fun and easy to turn on and off. For a wireless headset the microphone sounds far better than most other wireless headsets despite is compressing the audio. I would recommend these to any gamer who would like a strong, robust and comfortable headset.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Nick Loughlin

customer_reviews.title: Razer Nari incredible sounds....best gaming headset
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely cracking headset, mic is clear and doesn’t pick up too much background noise. THX spatial sound is incredible, you really hear enemies creeping up on you and sound direction is impossibly good. Best gaming headset I’ve ever owned. Recommended to me by son and his gaming mates, very very good. If you game and use a headset you’ll get a lot more enjoyment using one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Adams

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: the sound quality as many have said is good, similar to the kraken 7.1 V2 but this headset adds base. everything i play my friends can hear, from you tube to the games im playing. the mic sounds muffled. practically useless because i cant speak to my friends.. will be looking to return.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, slightly uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: The headphones have good quality, the sound pulses itself takes a little to get used too but after a few weeks the sound is amazing. It's suited well for FPS and when an explosion goes off in-game you can feel it. The dial to scroll between in-game and chat works well and is easy to use. The only downside is that the headset is a bit uncomfortable after a few hours and the new sound style for me gives me a headache. I would recommend this for someone who wants intense gameplay for short periods but not for extended gameplay.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: Comfy for hours on end
customer_reviews.text: Sound is great, wireless is the best. Pretty sturdy, battery lasts a long time. These are both my word headset and my gaming set, seems to have enough juice to do both without needing to charge inbetween. The software is a bit fiddly in the beginning and the lighting seems a bit silly on these. Overall I like them a lot and good upgrade from Logitech G430s which made the top of my headsore these Razer Nari do not. These feel great on the head.
customer_reviews.author: Rhys Cranfield

customer_reviews.title: Falls off your head!
customer_reviews.text: No way to tighten the headset onto your head like a normal headset, it just hangs loosely on your head. Its quite heavy and as a result doesn't feel stable, it fell off my head numerous times when moving my head around or standing up. Sound quality and build quality is excellent, very comfortable to wear and good sound but I sent it back due to the above mentioned issue. Great shame as I really liked it otherwise :(
customer_reviews.author: Clifford

customer_reviews.title: Not for Xbox One.
customer_reviews.text: As a headset for sound it is good (not as good as steelseries), the heptics become boring very quickly and they are too much. The main problem which is a total deal breaker and effectively renders the headset a £150 pile of plastic and metal is that the headset replays the sound of your party members back at them so they have a ludicrously loud echo. Another problem (which isnt advertised on any sellers website) is that this headset, even though it is advertised as being wireless) doesn't work as such with an xbox one. The material quality of the product also feels extremely cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: Sounds and feels great but just 1 concern.
customer_reviews.text: First day with the product and it seems pretty good. I did have to turn the bass uo to 75 in synapse as its a little tinny out of the box. Mic quality is okay but i will probably end up buying an external mic. Headset looks and feels great but i have some concerns about the two plastic bars that hold the speakers to thr frame. They seem to bend easily and feel like they could snap with little force. I ordered the essential version and to be honest its all you need for a headset. Simple, good sound, decent mic and great looking.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Newton

customer_reviews.title: Headache
customer_reviews.text: These need to be set up on a laptop 1st before they'll work which is a total headache and even installing the program took hours with multiple error codes. They are also not wireless with Xbox and need a cable to the controller. The sound was so poor it made my standard Xbox headset sound good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are Terrible DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Mic audio is absolutely rubbish its so terrible not what i expected when the razer 7.1 kraken chroma mic is the best headset mic ive ever used it sounds like a professional mic. the audio is awful , you listen to music and then when some bass plays all the vocals go quiet and it cant be fixed. DO NOT BUY THESE.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: COMFORT!!!
customer_reviews.text: the most comfortable headset i have ever owned i can and have worn these for a solid 18hrs straight and not once felt that need to take them off. the cooling pads are nice for the first hour but naturally they do warm up abit but never feel uncomfortable. they are amazing
customer_reviews.author: michael g.

customer_reviews.title: BUY THEM NOW (ULTIMATE)
customer_reviews.text: Honestly the best head phones ever! (Nari ultimate) you can turn the lighting off and the vibration mode off. However if you are playing a game or listening to music then please I beg turn the vibration on. After testing the vibration off I was just browsing music and honestly it's amazing however without the feedback of the virbartion it just feels emotionless. Honestly I don't think I can ever use any other pair of headphones again. Don't buy the essential or the plain nari it's pointless. I understand they are expensive but the feedback is a must have thing. I feel like I'm at a concert or in the game. It's actually crazy. Five stars!
customer_reviews.author: Coeby Roughley

customer_reviews.title: £200 and they don't even work
customer_reviews.text: Mic doesn't work properly, i'm being told my voice is cutting out and people can only hear half of what I say. Audio cuts out on my end too so I only hear half of what I am listening too. You have to keep the mic ridiculously close for it to work, you almost have to put it in your mouth. Such an expensive headset and such a complete let down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No sound for some games
customer_reviews.text: Battery is pretty decent. Noise cancellation is good. On a good day the range is as advertised, but occasionally I'll lose signal if i'm more than a meter away from the receiver. Sometimes all i have to do is turn my head and it will cut off. Some games will not output any sound with this headset at all and ive had to switch to my old wired pair to play them. (Newest drivers installed and im on Windows 10, nothing odd about my setup) Razer synapse bloatware is very annoying. Definitely style over substance.
customer_reviews.author: John Terry

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 3 days
customer_reviews.text: the Nari was an incredible set of headphone lots of bass and sound quality was incredible. Though the mic was terrible and broke after a day of use. Games like fortnite or other multiplayer games are not the best suit for these headphones. solo games would be the best fit.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Holt

customer_reviews.title: mic not working
customer_reviews.text: I bought this headset on same day delivery and it arrived in perfect condition. I opened it up straight away to see how it was on my head, fits really good and is made really well. however when I set it up the mic doesn't work, which is a man aspect of playing online games. Going to need to send it back and hopefully the replacement will work. overall the sound for the headset is amazing, just the mic that lets it down to a 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: Darren McLean

customer_reviews.title: Mixed bag, not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Pros - pretty good sound, decent battery life (with rumble off), very comfy, work well with glasses, easy to connect. Cons - intermittent wireless connection, rumble a bit of a gimmick (plus much better battery life with it turned off), mic monitoring non existant, mic placement is very precise, very expensive for what they are. I "upgraded" from some £50 turtle beach wired to controller cans to these ones and honestly they're not worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: An ‘okay’ headset
customer_reviews.text: This gaming headset is great but highly overpriced for what you’re getting, mine has already broken even though i used it with care, if you sneeze or lean back, the headset falls off, if you’re a console user (like me) you cannot turn off the rgb, so you’re getting 5-6 hours battery life, and thats terrible for gaming, i honestly recommend a steel series headset or the corsair hs50’s, thankyou for reading:)
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Constantly Disconnects
customer_reviews.text: I use these headphones to play games, everything works fine until they decide to constantly disconnect and reconnect. This has happened ever since I bought them and is annoying with the connect and disconnect sound constantly playing. Wouldn’t recommend, unless using them in wired mode (but what’s the point, as they’re wireless headphones?).
customer_reviews.author: boq

customer_reviews.title: Great headset but don’t let them die...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing but when almost flat it keeps disconnecting from my PC and connecting again making that sound as if I’ve just plugged/unplugged a new device, but maybe I should stop letting them almost die haha, it’s irritating and possibly a return reason for some but my god the THX Audio is amazing and it works on my iPhone with THX to so bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best headsets I have ever had the pleasure of owning. The bass is incredible , the sound is crystal clear and it puts you in a different world , especially when gaming, I cannot hear the outside world at all, with this headset on and I love it! Honest criticism is that the mic is okay! But not great, I do a lot of recording gameplay and hearing my voice on playback ... it’s not fantastic. Other than that, it’s awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Dom

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but disappointing sound and voice.
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is very poor. Most of the high tones are missing. A very comfortable headset. Battery while playing and talking lasted 5 hours. People reported I sounded distant while on voice.
customer_reviews.author: Mitis Green

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality and comfort
customer_reviews.text: The comfort of this headset compared to any other I've used is so much better for long term gaming. No sweating and no annoying pressure pains. Sound quality is amazing, you really feel like you are part of the game, hearing everything around you. The only down side (and this is my fault) is that I have to connect to my xbox controller using jack plug, and for this reason I would recommend the Razor Nari Ultimate instead as it comes in an xbox compatible bundle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Boomy, but doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: The headphones feel great and sound pretty good. It's true what they say, it feels like 2 small subwoofers taped to your head! I personally loved them. However, if you're using them for PS4 do not get them, to get both sides of the headphones to play audio you need to be wired into the controller, doing this also cuts out the microphone. Whilst wireless one side of the headphones doesn't work but the mic does. Hopefully this was just a defective item.
customer_reviews.author: Myles Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Not wireless on Xbox
customer_reviews.text: Only used briefly before sending back as it wasn't overly clear from the description that these don't work wirelessly with an Xbox. I used them wired for a bit just to get by and the sound quality is good but not as good as the Steel Series 9X that I replaced them with.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for gaming
customer_reviews.text: This is a rather interesting product. Although the Hypersense feature sometimes gets annoying and some content is impossible to enjoy with it, others become truly spectacular. Firing guns and feeling impacts around you with THX surround is actually amazing. Everything feels great both in wired and wireless mode. Beware though because it is HUGE. Not everyone can find it comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Alp Alpturk

customer_reviews.title: Not Xbox compatible.
customer_reviews.text: Incredible headphones but just do not work properly with Xbox. Mic is on constant transmit, wired connection to the controller is the only way to get the audio (which is superb), and the Razer software could not recognise the headphones to make any changes via my PC.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie H

customer_reviews.title: One of the best headsets I've owned
customer_reviews.text: Had these now for a while. I dont use the mic as I have a stand alone mic but the sound quality is great. I like the feature of the chat and game sound differential as I sit in discord with friends while in game so I can balance it well. The battery life is good i charge them overnight and I can get a solid 12 hours out of them. I was struggling to find a good wireless headset after using corsair, steelseries and ROG. It these are comfy and perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Solid battery good for casual gamers
customer_reviews.text: Batter lasts for about 20 hours with lighting and about 25 without lighting, 15 charge time. The mic is okay for talking to friends but not much else. The sound quality is good (about the same as any 60 quid wired pair of headphones). Great response time as well. I would recommend this if you just need them for playing games casualy and want to just get up and walk around your house whilst still being able too talk to your friends but if you have this much money for headphones and would prefer sound quality then go for some studio headphones and a seperate mic.
customer_reviews.author: Louis

customer_reviews.title: Only pc gets full features (false advertisement)
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy unless you have pc Sound is not customisable unless you use with pc For consoles do not buy sound is too over powering and vibrations are crude Thanks games radar for the poor review does not mention the above Shame on Nari a bit of false advertising here You must download software to change the settings of headphones they probably great on a pc Console users avoid
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Razer can cut through Logitech.
customer_reviews.text: Having used a Logitech G935 headset for the past year thought that I would never need an upgrade, well I thought hella wrong. Sound quality is far more superior while combining the haptic feed makes EVERY game, movie, trailer or whatever you are watching much better. These are the next best thing to the xbox series x. Nice job!!!
customer_reviews.author: Phantom

customer_reviews.title: Bad Mic, Decent Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Wireless -Well built -Looks good Cons: -Terrible mic quality -Mediocre sound quality -ear cups much thicker than other razer headphones. I’m only keeping these because they’re wireless. If they weren’t I’d return them. My old Razer Kraken 7.1 V2 and even V1 had a mic 10x better, more comfortable (maybe because they’ve been worn more.)
customer_reviews.author: Enzo

customer_reviews.title: Very good!
customer_reviews.text: Great headset overall. Love the haptics and the overall sound quality. The mic is abit on the dodgy side so I purchased a blue yeti blackout. The only real problem I had with this headset is when I was charging it and using it at the same time it stopped audio for chat and game and kept making me tab out of the game which is frustrating. But overall a good headset and would recommend to people who like competitive and immersive gaming!
customer_reviews.author: Luke M.

customer_reviews.title: Issues with PlayStation
customer_reviews.text: These are great but it does have a few issues. When it is wired in you can't mute the mic. Also when using with the PlayStation. When the dongal is plugged in and the headphones are off and you want to watch something on the PlayStation. It you won't get sound through the telly. You have either unplug the dongal or go into the settings and change to tv. It won't swap automatically. There are very comfortable and the sound is good.
customer_reviews.author: kate gammage

customer_reviews.title: Not for xbox users
customer_reviews.text: If you're purchasing this for xbox DON'T! Was so excited to get these but when I used them for the first time in part chat the voice of my friends echoed and so did my game volume into the microphone. This is a reoccurring issue in the headset! I'm so disappointed after wanting a razer product for ages this has out me of them for life now
customer_reviews.author: Kieran Smith

customer_reviews.title: One of the best out there
customer_reviews.text: Had this product for a few months now. The gel in the ear cups is still noticeably cool and has a nice smell to it. The haptic feedback is NOT just a gimmick! When you get used to it going to "normal" headphones just isn't the same, I don't always have it enabled as it can be too much but it adds a whole new dimension to games (the thuds of the horse galloping on red dead redemption 2 for example) I highly reccomend for those that want to spend a chunk of money for a high end gaming headset.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is absurdly good!
customer_reviews.text: The sound you get through these headphones is outstanding. But you would expect that from the price. The haptic feedback option is really nice as well, especially for racing games. I would recommend these headphones to anyone that plays a lot of games. The batter life is superb. And they are very comfy for long gaming sessions.
customer_reviews.author: Ronan Davis

customer_reviews.title: Good but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Good headset but not perfect. EQ is pretty bad and it does sound muffled unless you sit down and keep Eqing. Vibrations are really cool though.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Webster

customer_reviews.title: Best headset ever
customer_reviews.text: I have never done a review on anything ever but I got the Nari middle one not essential not ultimate, this is the best sounding quality I’ve ever heard through my ears, it’s too good not to write a review, I’ve had about 8 headsets and this one is next level, you will Not regret buying this incredible headset, the customisation on the pc that you can do is unbelievable how in depth it is, one of the best buys ever for me
customer_reviews.author: Conor

customer_reviews.title: un happy
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace a set of Cheap Turtle Beach very unhappy with them as the cheaper set sounded Better and was not messing about with settings trying to get the game to sound right,Chat on the PS 4 is rubbish if your friend got a set always getting feed back off both sets makes it Horrible experience for both of us DO NOT BUY if your going to use on ps 4 for chat
customer_reviews.author: Ronald

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: The vibrate feature gives you a massive head ache. Side tone too low Can’t hear yourself talking so you will find yourself shouting unless you put the mic in your mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B.

customer_reviews.title: great headset
customer_reviews.text: when i decided to buy this i was between 2 minds whether to spend extra and get the astro a50's or these. anyway i went with these and im glad i did, the sound quality is great for my needs. the build quality is good. there are some cheap plastic parts, but i imagine its to keep the weight down but the retention band is metal. when listening to music i turn off the haptics so the battery lasts longer... my only gripe is that there is no on light. so i keep chroma on so i can tell if its on or off
customer_reviews.author: MAGiCR

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUT IF YOU TALK ONLINE
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely afaul for the price, the sound is adequate but the microphone is terrible and when using it on Xbox other people in the party can hear your game sound and there is a massive echo. Razer have address this issue and there is still no fix. So if you will be talking to people with the headset DO NOT BUY. However for single player games the haptic is really good and adds to the experience. I returned mine immediately and will be buying another headset.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Milner

customer_reviews.title: Great headset! Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Really good quality headset! Love it being wireless, as I have a tendency to damage wires as they get too tangled! But with it being wireless it's great. The quality of the headset is one of the best I've had yet, definitely worth the price paid. The sound cancellation isn't the best but isn't really an important factor of a headset to me. I use it for gaming obviously, and it is perfect, it has directional sound as well!
customer_reviews.author: Jack Cole

customer_reviews.title: headphone software is aweful
customer_reviews.text: after 3 months of use the headphones are dead they do not charge, they do not turn on, never dropped the headphones, always charged with me watching closely to not overcharge them because they do not seem to have overcharge protection, i used them today 29.04.2019 before work and they had charge in them to last for days without use, i come back from work and try to turn them on, nothing... i plug the charging cable... nothing, no charging LED lit up, i checked the cable for a possible fault but its not the cable, its the headphones, they just randomly killed themselves, do not buy these headphones
customer_reviews.author: Konrad

customer_reviews.title: high price for haptic gimmick
customer_reviews.text: great to start with but had trouble when the soundscape was full on distorts, the haptic was ok to start with but became annoying switched it off in the end rumbles when you dont expect does not react when you are being shot ,rumble also makes you miss cues like footsteps during COD SO RETURED GOT STEALTH 700 GEN 2 HAPPY NOW
customer_reviews.author: kev d

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Overall
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Fantastic sound quality both in stereo and surround sound. Comfortable fit with an easily adjustable head rest, even after long sessions of gaming doesn't feel heavy at all. Haptic feedback is surprisingly immersive, not only hearing explosions or heavy bass in music changes but feeling them too adds so much more to immersion. Cons: minor struggling with charging whilst using the headset. Sometimes windows throws a fit and will constantly chime a new device being plugged in and removed. Restarting Synapse usually fixes.
customer_reviews.author: Tom R.

customer_reviews.title: Fails cordless mobile connection
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed that it doesn’t connect to mobile. Fails purpose of cordless. Had to resort to Razer kraken with cords.
customer_reviews.author: ruthevea

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought for son, he is very happy with sound quality for music and gaming, Chroma lighting and cordless make these a very good buy
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Fatal flaw in the headset causes it to cut out when the sound goes too quiet. CANNOT BE FIXED.
customer_reviews.text: If I turn down the sound quiet enough the headset will automatically make the sound quieter and quieter until it completely shuts off and then if the sound gets loud enough the headset will then switch back on and you can hear again. Turns out this issue is a fatal flaw in the headset and CANNOT be fixed. Extremely disappointing and extremely annoying considering the price of this headset.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Bad range
customer_reviews.text: It's ok pretty comfy but my biggest issue is the Bluetooth range is abysmal to the point where if you leave the room it disconnects compared to other headsets this is very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Clare Turner

customer_reviews.title: When they work, they're good...
customer_reviews.text: As per the title. The small rotating volume dial sometimes causes one side of the headphone to stop outputting audio. This is the same for many headphones with that idiotic volume control dial. I have to often hit the headphones or put a lot of pressure on to the dial to get both sides working. Can't complain about battery life or sound quality though!
customer_reviews.author: Amazons' Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from Logitech Headset
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with the Nari Ultimate. Sounds great in all PC games and the haptic feedback is a great addition. The headset goes really well with the Razer Headset Stand. Would recommend to any one looking for loud, powerful audio.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Star

customer_reviews.title: Blows the mind (and your ear drums)
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely phenomenal sound, don't think I could ever switch to something else for gaming , fully recommended
customer_reviews.author: Shell N' Jord

customer_reviews.title: Good for price
customer_reviews.text: The sound so far is quality, and everything about it for me is really cool. The only issue is that the box clearly states xbox one, but it does not work at all. Why the company have it printed on the box, but then put something completely different on the website is beyond me. Well worth the money though.
customer_reviews.author: Dane Beaumont

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not recommend it
customer_reviews.text: I am about to return my second pair right now and would not ever touch Razer Headset again. These are making buzzing noise on high pitched voices in games or videos. I compared them on different computers and with other headsets and speakers and they are the only one. Horrible quality for the price tag. Comfort is the only good thing about them.
customer_reviews.author: Florin Ungureanu

customer_reviews.title: Be careful buying these (review is not about the actual product itself)
customer_reviews.text: I got a very obviously used model that has the main missing component - the wireless 2.4GHz dongle Working with Amazon right now on a resolution so will update this review later
customer_reviews.author: Andrew L

customer_reviews.title: Better headset available - Xbox one
customer_reviews.text: Shouldn't be advertised as a wireless headset for xbox one. It is only compatible with the use of a cable to the controller. Save your coins and buy the steel series X9. Tinny sounding & spatial awareness is none existent. Good noise cancellation though & the design is cool but not adjustable enough for it to be a nice fit for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My son absolutely loves these. He tried a couple of other headphones... he reckons these are the best!
customer_reviews.author: Lorna Murray

customer_reviews.title: Nari ultimate
customer_reviews.text: It's good but I noticed the vibration motor in the left ear started rattling. It wasn't like this before. This happened after 4 months of use. I assume this is out of the ordinary and is probably a rare case, but just be warned
customer_reviews.author: Dima

customer_reviews.title: Too loud
customer_reviews.text: Headphones so loud everyone can hear your game through the mic. Disappointed with this purchase. Avoid
customer_reviews.author: A jamieson

customer_reviews.title: the vibrations, the games i play, wot wos, call of the wild
customer_reviews.text: its the only head phones that fits me ears properly, i have a a50, g533 and rog 7.1, i find the ear pads are a bit on the small side, plus can be used with a TV, as long as you have a long cable,
customer_reviews.author: keith

customer_reviews.title: Had lots of disconnecting
customer_reviews.text: Mine was constantly reconnecting when wireless, sometimes many times in a row, after speaking with Razer support they said they will replace if I send this one back. The sound quality is nice but not as impressive as it looks on paper and the software you use is still in beta and has a few issues itself. It's a nice headset but unless you really have the money just buy the cheaper Nari.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: razor nair headset
customer_reviews.text: i’m having trouble setting them up wirelessly need help have no instructions can’t use them unless they plugged into controller annoying for the price really
customer_reviews.author: Nina Farnsworth

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Audio, Terrible Microphone quality.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent audio quality, good surround sound and provides good in game experience. However, one thing that I didn’t like was the mic, the microphone quality is DISGUSTING, it’s honestly trash, I bought this headset to replace my Razer Kraken Pro V2 and they are pretty much the same but my Krakens have a way better mic than the Nari.
customer_reviews.author: Muhammad Kamal

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth The Money!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn’t recommend these headphones at all there horrible for music not too good for gaming features ruins the sound quality not even had them a year and I don’t like them. So look at a different brand or other headphones or wait till these headphones go way down in price on sale.
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher G.

customer_reviews.title: Not xbox compatable
customer_reviews.text: Pretty unimpressed to discover that these WIRELESS headphones only work with the Xbox One via a 3.5mm cable. I will be returning. This really should be clearer in the descriptor.
customer_reviews.author: rupert willday

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound and mic quality
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound and mic quality, great battery life too. Don't forget to put it on charge after prolonged use though as the battery does tend to die after about 24 hours of total use. Can be used whilst charging though so doesn't cause issue
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Amazing overall but:
customer_reviews.text: This work amazing do the job well, only thing I would say is that the frame of the headset feels like it weakens overtime with use. I’ve had these for about a month again the quality of sound is amazing great battery life and sound clarity. Just wished the frame felt more study.
customer_reviews.author: Jamal Khan

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality, not so good mic.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy to wear, comfy round the ears, only problem with them. Is my friends say the microphone is very quiet compared to my previous headphones the razer man o war ones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Xbox Wireless Headphones
customer_reviews.text: These came with great reviews for wireless headphones and the haptics were really something I fancied Unfortunately they are not wireless if you have a Xbox One as you have to use the 3.5mm jacks....... sent back to search again
customer_reviews.author: Nick Pinkney

customer_reviews.title: Amazing headset, explosions are epic but mic lacks badly
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing if your looking for the highest end headset. My tv speakers never worked so I always used headphones so i thought I’d upgrade and this is amazing. Works beautifully with VR also. Explosions are unreal and epic one. However mic is crap and echoes majorly. However if you only use it to communicate to friends like me it’ll do
customer_reviews.author: Rhys

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t connect to Xbox wireless
customer_reviews.text: I believed it to be wireless but after 30 mins of figuring it out watching videos it is not wireless compatible with the Xbox one which really is annoying as it doesn’t state this when buying it but everything else is perfect great headset but for the price for a wired headset I should of stuck to Astro
customer_reviews.author: Kieran

product_meta.title: Razer Nari Essential – Wireless Gaming Headset (Bluetooth Gaming Headset with HyperSense Technology, THX Spatial Audio 360 Degree & RGB Chroma for PC, PS4 & Switch)
product_meta.description:
The Razer Nari Essential is designed for gamers who seek core features, superior comfort and incredible sound in a wireless gaming headset. An auto-adjusting headband fits the headset onto the unique shape of your head, while its aluminium body makes it lightweight to wear and provides durability with plush leatherette ear cushions that completely cover your ears, enjoy superior sound isolation without compromising on comfort. THX Spatial Audio delivers next-generation virtual surround sound for a more powerful immersive experience.

THX Spatial Audio: Breaks the boundaries of defined 5.1 and 7.1 channel surround to deliver seamless 360 Degree positional audio for a more natural and lifelike experience.

 Total Enhanced Comfort: Its auto-adjusting headband comfortably fits your head while its unibody aluminium frame keeps it lightweight even after hours of wear 2.4 GHz.

 Wireless Audio: Get lag-free, high-fidelity gaming audio with a wireless range of up to 12 m smoothly without disconnection.

16-Hour Battery Life: Enjoy up to 16 hours of uninterrupted gaming, streaming or movies with a battery that just goes on, you can stay immersed in all your favourite entertainment.

Flip Microphone: with a flip microphone featuring passive noise cancellation, your every shout-call is heard with crystal clear clarity.
feature_bullets: THX spatial audio: Go beyond traditional virtual surround sound. THX spatial audio breaks the boundaries of defined 5.1 and 7.1 channel surround to deliver seamless 360° positional audio for a more natural and lifelike experience. It also adds depth by simulating sound both above and beneath you for incredible gaming immersion. Available with Razer synapse

Total enhanced comfort: The Razer nari essential is one of the most comfortable headsets you will ever don. Its auto-adjusting headband comfortably fits your head while its unibody aluminum frame keeps it lightweight even after hours of wear. The cooling gel ear cushions provide both comfort and sound isolation

2.4 GHz wireless audio: Get lag-free, high-fidelity gaming audio with 2.4 GHz wireless technology. A plug-and-play wireless USB transceiver lets you enjoy a wireless range of up to 12 m smoothly without disconnection. With audio controls directly on the headset, you can do everything from adjusting volume to muting your mic on the fly
16-hour battery life: Enjoy up to 16 hours of uninterrupted gaming, streaming or movies. With a battery that just goes on, you can stay immersed in all your favorite entertainment

Flip microphone: With a flip microphone featuring passive noise cancellation, your every shout-call is heard with crystal clear clarity. Plus, muting audio is effortlessly simple - just flip the mic up and it’s out of the way

specifications.Delivery information:: We cannot deliver certain products outside mainland UK
